intro: Alansmia cocosensis, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, purple flowers that bloom at night, attracting specific pollinators. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a small, yellowish berry. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
